name: py-pillow-simd

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
Pillow-SIMD is a SIMD-enabled fork of Pillow. It is usually 4-6x faster
than the original Pillow in image processing benchmarks.

dependencies.name: freetype
dependencies.description:
FreeType is a freely available software library to render fonts. It is
written in C, designed to be small, efficient, highly customizable, and
portable while capable of producing high-quality output (glyph images)
of most vector and bitmap font formats.

dependencies.name: jpeg
dependencies.description:
MozJPEG is a patched version of libjpeg-turbo which improves JPEG
compression efficiency achieving higher visual quality and smaller file
sizes at the same time

dependencies.name: lcms
dependencies.description:
Little cms is a color management library. Implements fast transforms
between ICC profiles. It is focused on speed, and is portable across
several platforms (MIT license).

dependencies.name: libimagequant
dependencies.description:
Small, portable C library for high-quality conversion of RGBA images to
8-bit indexed-color (palette) images.

dependencies.name: libraqm
dependencies.description: Raqm provides a convenient API for the logic of complex text layout.

dependencies.name: libtiff
dependencies.description: LibTIFF - Tag Image File Format (TIFF) Library and Utilities.

dependencies.name: libwebp
dependencies.description:
WebP is a modern image format that provides superior lossless and lossy
compression for images on the web. Using WebP, webmasters and web
developers can create smaller, richer images that make the web faster.

dependencies.name: libxcb
dependencies.description:
The X protocol C-language Binding (XCB) is a replacement for Xlib
featuring a small footprint, latency hiding, direct access to the
protocol, improved threading support, and extensibility.

dependencies.name: openjpeg
dependencies.description:
OpenJPEG is an open-source JPEG 2000 codec written in C language. It has
been developed in order to promote the use of JPEG 2000, a still-image
compression standard from the Joint Photographic Experts Group (JPEG).
Since April 2015, it is officially recognized by ISO/IEC and ITU-T as a
JPEG 2000 Reference Software.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: python-venv
dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment

dependencies.name: zlib-api
dependencies.description: zlib replacement with optimizations for next generation systems.

dependent_to.name: py-pauvre
dependent_to.description: pauvre: plotting package designed for nanopore and PacBio long reads

dependent_to.name: py-ipycanvas
dependent_to.description: Interactive Canvas in Jupyter.

dependent_to.name: py-ultralytics
dependent_to.description:
Ultralytics YOLOv8, developed by Ultralytics, is a cutting-edge, state-
of-the-art (SOTA) model that builds upon the success of previous YOLO
versions and introduces new features and improvements to further boost
performance and flexibility. YOLOv8 is designed to be fast, accurate,
and easy to use, making it an excellent choice for a wide range of
object detection, image segmentation and image classification tasks.

dependent_to.name: timemory
dependent_to.description:
Modular profiling toolkit and suite of libraries and tools for
C/C++/Fortran/CUDA/Python

dependent_to.name: py-pycortex
dependent_to.description: Python Cortical mapping software for fMRI data.

dependent_to.name: py-tree
dependent_to.description: A package for creating and drawing trees.

dependent_to.name: py-mouseinfo
dependent_to.description:
An application to display XY position and RGB color information for the
pixel currently under the mouse. Works on Python 2 and 3. This is useful
for GUI automation planning.

dependent_to.name: py-matplotlib
dependent_to.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-contextily
dependent_to.description: Context geo-tiles in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-streamlit
dependent_to.description: The fastest way to build data apps in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-reportlab
dependent_to.description:
The ReportLab Toolkit. An Open Source Python library for generating PDFs
and graphics.

dependent_to.name: py-gym
dependent_to.description:
OpenAI Gym is a toolkit for developing and comparing reinforcement
learning algorithms. This is the gym open-source library, which gives
you access to a standardized set of environments.

dependent_to.name: py-cinemasci
dependent_to.description: A set of python tools for reading, writing and viewing Cinema databases

dependent_to.name: py-pyscreeze
dependent_to.description:
PyScreeze can take screenshots, save them to files, and locate images
within the screen. This is useful if you have a small image of, say, a
button that needs to be clicked and want to locate it on the screen.

dependent_to.name: py-torchgeo
dependent_to.description:
TorchGeo: datasets, samplers, transforms, and pre-trained models for
geospatial data.

dependent_to.name: py-lightly-utils
dependent_to.description: A utility package for lightly.

dependent_to.name: py-wxpython
dependent_to.description: Cross platform GUI toolkit for Python.

dependent_to.name: py-segmentation-models-pytorch
dependent_to.description:
Python library with Neural Networks for Image Segmentation based on
PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-datalad
dependent_to.description:
data distribution geared toward scientific datasets. DataLad makes data
management and data distribution more accessible. To do that, it stands
on the shoulders of Git and Git-annex to deliver a decentralized system
for data exchange. This includes automated ingestion of data from online
portals and exposing it in readily usable form as Git(-annex)
repositories, so-called datasets. The actual data storage and permission
management, however, remains with the original data providers.

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-image
dependent_to.description:
Image processing algorithms for SciPy, including IO, morphology,
filtering, warping, color manipulation, object detection, etc.

dependent_to.name: py-keras
dependent_to.description:
Multi-backend Keras. Keras 3 is a new multi-backend implementation of
the Keras API, with support for TensorFlow, JAX, and PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-datalad-deprecated
dependent_to.description:
DataLad extension package for deprecated functionality that was phased
out in the core package.

dependent_to.name: py-fracridge
dependent_to.description: Fractional Ridge Regression.

dependent_to.name: py-sphinx-gallery
dependent_to.description:
A `Sphinx` extension that builds an HTML version of any Python script
and puts it into an examples gallery.

dependent_to.name: py-trimesh
dependent_to.description: Import, export, process, analyze and view triangular meshes

dependent_to.name: py-heat
dependent_to.description:
Heat is a flexible and seamless open-source software for high
performance data analytics and machine learning. It provides highly
optimized algorithms and data structures for tensor computations using
CPUs, GPUs and distributed cluster systems on top of MPI.

dependent_to.name: py-continuum
dependent_to.description: A clean and simple data loading library for Continual Learning

dependent_to.name: py-fury
dependent_to.description: Free Unified Rendering in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-cartopy
dependent_to.description: Cartopy - a cartographic python library with matplotlib support.

dependent_to.name: py-fastai
dependent_to.description:
You can use fastai without any installation by using Google Colab. In
fact, every page of this documentation is also available as an
interactive notebook - click "Open in colab" at the top of any page to
open it (be sure to change the Colab runtime to "GPU" to have it run
fast!) See the fast.ai documentation on Using Colab for more
information.

dependent_to.name: py-pytorch-lightning
dependent_to.description: PyTorch Lightning is the lightweight PyTorch wrapper for ML researchers.

dependent_to.name: py-visdom
dependent_to.description:
Visdom aims to facilitate visualization of (remote) data with an
emphasis on supporting scientific experimentation.

dependent_to.name: py-neptune-client
dependent_to.description:
Flexible metadata store for MLOps, built for research and production
teams that run a lot of experiments.

dependent_to.name: py-wordcloud
dependent_to.description: A little word cloud generator in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-pyvista
dependent_to.description: Easier Pythonic interface to VTK.

dependent_to.name: py-pytesseract
dependent_to.description:
Python-tesseract is an Optical Character Recognition (OCR) Tool for
python.

dependent_to.name: py-imgaug
dependent_to.description:
A library for image augmentation in machine learning experiments,
particularly convolutional neural networks. Supports the augmentation of
images, keypoints/landmarks, bounding boxes, heatmaps and segmentation
maps in a variety of different ways.

dependent_to.name: py-antspyx
dependent_to.description: Advanced Normalization Tools in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-imageio
dependent_to.description:
Python library for reading and writing image data. Imageio is a Python
library that provides an easy interface to read and write a wide range
of image data, including animated images, video, volumetric data, and
scientific formats. It is cross-platform, runs on Python 2.7 and 3.4+,
and is easy to install.

dependent_to.name: py-gluoncv
dependent_to.description:
GluonCV provides implementations of state-of-the-art (SOTA) deep
learning algorithms in computer vision. It aims to help engineers,
researchers, and students quickly prototype products, validate new ideas
and learn computer vision.

dependent_to.name: py-openslide-python
dependent_to.description: OpenSlide Python is a Python interface to the OpenSlide library.

dependent_to.name: py-torchvision
dependent_to.description: Image and video datasets and models for torch deep learning.

dependent_to.name: py-basemap
dependent_to.description:
The matplotlib basemap toolkit is a library for plotting 2D data on maps
in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-pyglet
dependent_to.description:
pyglet is a cross-platform windowing and multimedia library for Python
for developing games and other visually rich applications.

dependent_to.name: py-torchmeta
dependent_to.description:
A collection of extensions and data-loaders for few-shot learning &
meta-learning in PyTorch. Torchmeta contains popular meta-learning
benchmarks, fully compatible with both torchvision and PyTorch's
DataLoader.

dependent_to.name: py-python-pptx
dependent_to.description: Generate and manipulate Open XML PowerPoint (.pptx) files.

dependent_to.name: py-gradio
dependent_to.description:
Python library for easily interacting with trained machine learning
models

dependent_to.name: py-ipympl
dependent_to.description: Matplotlib Jupyter Extension.

dependent_to.name: py-timm
dependent_to.description: (Unofficial) PyTorch Image Models.

dependent_to.name: py-pdf2image
dependent_to.description:
A python module that wraps the pdftoppm utility to convert PDF to PIL
Image object

dependent_to.name: py-bokeh
dependent_to.description: Statistical and novel interactive HTML plots for Python

dependent_to.name: py-pycbc
dependent_to.description:
PyCBC is a software package used to explore astrophysical sources of
gravitational waves. It contains algorithms to analyze gravitational-
wave data from the LIGO and Virgo detectors, detect coalescing compact
binaries, and measure the astrophysical parameters of detected sources.
PyCBC was used in the first direct detection of gravitational waves and
is used in the flagship analysis of LIGO and Virgo data.

dependent_to.name: halide
dependent_to.description:
Halide is a programming language designed to make it easier to write
high-performance image and array processing code on modern machines.

dependent_to.name: py-imagehash
dependent_to.description: A Python Perceptual Image Hashing Module
